activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Lee Gibson

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.

11:08 AM Defendant Aaron Lee Gibson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent. Court appoints attorney Katharine Cullen, defendant to pay $100/month per month. Scheduling order to be sent out to parties.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Lee Gibson appeared by phone. Defendant to file petition for court appointed attorney. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified of all proceedings.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:32 PM Defendant Aaron Lee Gibson in court by phone.  Intern Verity Altenberger by video supervised by Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth confirmed, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond of $1000 set.  No violent contact with A.G.   Defendant must sign bond June 28, 2022 between 12 pm and 1 pm.  Defendant to call public defender.    Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No violent or disorderly contact directly or indirectly with victim A.G., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
